<think>
Most sources confirm that Napoleon's wife was Joséphine de Beauharnais. Using this information, I can now provide a comprehensive response to the user's question.

This painting illustrates the coronation of Napoleon Bonaparte as Emperor of the French, a ceremony held on December 2, 1804, at Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris. Likely painted by Jacques-Louis David, the artwork captures the moment when Napoleon crowns his wife, Joséphine de Beauharnais, as Empress. She is depicted kneeling before Napoleon as he prepares to place the crown on her head.
